page.title: 05EXWICK BAKERY
page.content: {British Bakeries}have a factory in New Valley Road, Exwick. They make 16 different types of{bread}and the white sliced loaf is most popular. 1/4 million loaves are made each week and each loaf takes 3.5 hours to make. They also make some{buns and cakes.}60 tons of flour are stored in each silo and they use 80 bags a day. The inside of the factory is hot and noisy. They use conveyor belts to go around the factory carrying buns, rolls, cakes and of course bread. Most jobs are done by{machines}but some are done by hand. The ovens are quite long and the bread is moved slowly through. {400 people}work there 7 days a week and they sometimes like their job. Hats and overalls are worn to keep germs away from the bread. Some of the staff drive big lorries and there are over 50 delivery vans.
